description.narrative: The Capacity Building Project is for the provision of training, resources coaching and mentoring and aims to build public sector and aid management capabilities in the Philippines. The project will equip AusAID Manila staff who work on programs providing the direct delivery of aid and targeted partner government staff, with the skills and knowledge to embed evaluative thinking and evidence into learning and mutual accountability processes. More importantly, the training will capacitate the participants to make better use of data in decision making to achieve better development results from the aid initiatives they manage. This training strengthens the commitment to improve aid effectiveness by enhancing evaluative capacities of those involved in the delivery of aid which is essential. The total value of this initiative is $0.3 million over 2 years, starting 2012-13.
